page.title: 11FEATURES
page.content: Principal Features:Shanklin Chine noted as a landslip area,reformed as a tourist attraction with beautiful scenery.Where the cliff has given way waterfalls have formed. Above there is a tea garden called Rylestone Gardens. In Sandown there is Battery Gardens. It is a tea garden and has access to the cliff path leading down to the sea.Battery Gardens were used as one of the Islands defences in the war.The tunnels can still be seen. The sand in Shanklin is golden in colour with few pebbles,but in Sandown the beach is a browny colour and has many stones.The cliffs tend to slope in places through erosion. They run from Shanklin through to Sandown Bay.
